title: Watford midfielder Valon Behrami wanted by Swiss side Sion as ‘talks begin over summer move’
text:
Comments 
WATFORD midfielder Valon Behrami is wanted by Swiss club Sion. 
The 31-year-old is under contract with the Hornets until 2018. He has made 23 appearances this season to help Walter Mazzarri’s side to 14th in the Premier League, seven points above the drop zone. Getty Images 3 Valon Behrami could be waving goodbye to Watford 
But Sion chairman Christian Constantin claims Behrami wants to return to Switzerland, and said they have been in talks with the 73-cap international for several months about a summer transfer. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Watford gossip and transfers on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Behrami started out playing football with Swiss club sides FC Stabio, FC Chiasso and FC Lugano, but joined Watford from Hamburg in 2015. He previously spent three seasons with West Ham after a £5million move from Lazio in 2008. Constantin said: “We have been in contact with Behrami since the winter. He wants to return to Switzerland, and I want to bring him to Sion. 
“He is keen on the idea. My son Barthelemy, our sporting director, has already had several meetings with him. Getty Images Behrami tries to gets stuck in to Raheem Sterling for Switzerland against England Getty Images 3 The midfielder has made 23 appearances this season 
“The fact he is under contract with Watford until 2018 is no problem. He has a clause that allows him to leave early. 
“He is a quality player, and his attitude is even more important. His willingness to sacrifice himself for the team impresses me.” Watford striker Troy Deeney scores a winning own goal for Crystal Palace 
Kosovo-born Behrami, who grew up in Switzerland, has also played for Genoa, Fiorentina and Napoli.
